findings.title: Mint, Burn and Settle includes duplicate checks
findings.description: The method Mint, Burn and Settle includes validations to check for blacklist and freeze list which can be avoided since the validation is performed by the beforeTokenTransfer method.

findings.title: Consider emitting events across the contract’s different functions
findings.description: Emitting events can enable a potential Dapp to monitor state-changing operations such as deposits, withdrawals, minting, burning, etc.

findings.title: Storage Fee is not reset and liability is transferred to the buyer
findings.description: The storage fee will keep on accumulating and the gold bar can be settled for the fee, affecting the final asset holder and not the previous owners.

findings.title: Dedicated deposit method can be removed
findings.description: The `deposit()` function does not track coins deposited or emit any event and its functionality can be achieved by directly transferring ETH or ERC20 tokens to the contract address.
